page.title: 17The Leisure Centre: FINTRY
page.content: This is in the centre of the village, and was a{school and schoolhouse from {1839 to 1961.}It comprises a suite of bedroom, bathroom and toilet for group leaders; kitchen, two other rooms, store, main hall (playroom and dormitory for 15 children), toilets, washroom and shower. There are small grounds including a disused tennis court, now used for free camping. {During the week}it is used regularly by the Silver Threads, by the Lunch Club for the elderly and the Toddler's Group and Playgroup. {During weekends}it is fully used for country holidays by recognised youth organisations such as school groups and Guides. It is controlled by Central Region's Sport Development Council and is one of only a few such facilities. It has had the same caretaker for 16 years.
